Created attachment 555351
Example of the element

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/13.0.782.112 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

I created an element with a padding and a relative position.
I use a pseudo selector ::before with an absolute position to add an extra background over the element.



Actual results:

the content in the pseudo selector was rendered next to the padding. 


Expected results:

it should have been rendered relative to the element itself, not it's padding

comments.text:
It's really important to note that even with an explicit padding of 0px on the button element, there is still implicit padding coming from somewhere. 

This can be seen in the jsfiddle example posted in Comment #3, by setting the padding to 0px. Do this and notice that the button element still shows some padding (about 2px worth). 

This prevents the obvious work-around of moving padding on the button to margin on an inner element.

I'm seeing this in FF 9.0.1 on Mac OSX 10.6.8
